image.altText: Football specatators watch a game on a foggy day

props.synopsis: In the Yarriambiack Shire, 350 kilometres from Melbourne in Victoria's rural north-west, virtually all of the towns are shrinking.

title.children: A quarter of this town's population has vanished. Experts say that could be terminal

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu and Donald Trump shake hands in front of their national flags.

props.synopsis: There is any number of ways the ceasefire could fall over — perhaps within days.

title.children: Why the shaky Gaza ceasefire could collapse

image.altText: A close up of two men in suits.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he will impose extra levies in response to what he called "extraordinarily aggressive" new Chinese export curbs on rare-earth minerals.

title.children: China accuses US of 'double standards' over new tariffs threat

image.altText: Abubakir Rafiq sepaking with left arm up at pro-Palestinian rally in Sydney's Hyde Park

props.synopsis: Protesters are gathering for dozens of pro-Palestinian demonstrations set to go ahead across the country, as a tentative ceasefire between Israel and Hamas continues. Follow live.

title.children: Protesters gather for pro-Palestinian rallies across Australia

image.altText: Jack Le Brocq drives the Erebus Motorsport Chevrolet Camaro on a wet circuit

props.synopsis: Brodie Kostecki and Todd Hazelwood started the Bathurst 1000 on pole, but a drive-through penalty and battery dramas have all-but ended the duo's hopes of back-to-back wins. Follow live.

title.children: Supercars slide around mountain as Bathurst 1000 reaches final quarter

image.altText: Household grocery items including milk, toilet paper, instant coffee and eggs.

props.synopsis: Last month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese invited Emirati hypermarket chain LuLu Group to compete with Coles and Woolworths for market share. But some retail experts say entry into Australia's supermarket sector isn't so simple.

title.children: A new supermarket has been invited to Australia. Here is how its prices stack up

image.altText: Troy Milne

props.synopsis: Police are appealing to the public for help in locating a man who left to pick up supplies while camping with his wife in Gippsland.

title.children: Man goes missing after picking up supplies camping in Gippsland

image.altText: An overhead view of Thursday Island. Houses, trees and beach.

props.synopsis: The 14-year-old is in a critical condition in Townsville University Hospital after a shark attack in the Torres Strait Islands.

title.children: Teen fights for life after shark attack off Thursday Island

image.altText: A man with short, grey hair holds his hands in a prayer gesture while standing at a lectern flanked by a man and a woman.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Israelis have gathered in Tel Aviv, where US envoy Steve Witkoff spoke to the crowd in anticipation of the release of the remaining hostages in Gaza.

title.children: Netanyahu booed as US envoy Witkoff addresses massive rally in Tel Aviv

image.altText: A group of people stand in darkness, holding candles.

props.synopsis: Authorities in the US say 16 people died in a massive explosion at a Tennessee munitions facility that has left a shocked community in mourning.

title.children: Community mourns as death toll from US munitions plant blast revised

image.altText: An soldier in uniform looks out onto a valley with a hill that has a fortified building on top.

props.synopsis: Afghan Taliban forces say they have captured Pakistani border posts, while Pakistani security officials say their military is responding "with full force" to the attack.

title.children: Afghan Taliban, Pakistani soldiers fight along border after Kabul air strike

image.altText: A man and woman stand on a rooftop.

props.synopsis: With a career beginning in the late 1970s, Diane Keaton would star in more than 100 films and earn several Oscar nods.

title.children: Diane Keaton was a charming, kooky on-screen force. Here are her best films

image.altText: A man in a Richmond AFL jumper, with his face painted yellow and black, looks into a mirror.

props.synopsis: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football — and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

title.children: Betting industry 'out of control', says former gambler

image.altText: A young girl wearing a blue uniform smiles as she sits at a desk in a classroom.

props.synopsis: The suspected murder-suicide of a mother and her daughter has raised serious questions about whether there were missed opportunities to intervene.

title.children: Clementine was a 'future leader'. Her mother is suspected of taking her life

image.altText: A woman is obscured by three overpacked tubs she is holding in front of her in a white room.

props.synopsis: Our emotional attachment to objects can make spring cleaning hard. So is it worth the effort?

title.children: Decluttering to 'spark joy'? Here is why tidying up can be so hard

image.altText: Five Sydney Swans AFLW players embrace as they celebrate a goal against the Blues.

props.synopsis: The Swans arrest a massive form slump to defeat the top-eight Blues by 39 points at Sydney's Henson Park.

title.children: Swans stun Blues to end four-match losing streak

image.altText: A woman's hand pulling something out of the fridge

props.synopsis: Experts share their tips on how to best store cooked food to save money and avoid food waste.

title.children: How can you safely store and reheat leftovers — and for how long?

image.altText: A young woman and an elderly woman smile at each other.

props.synopsis: Australia has 13 million spare rooms, according to a census data analysis. Could boarding be a solution to the housing crisis?

title.children: We have a lot of spare bedrooms — but boarders' rights are unclear

image.altText: family on the beach

props.synopsis: Buyers who bought off-the-plan at a Gold Coast housing development years ago weren't just purchasing a home — they were purchasing a dream. Now, the developer is trying to cancel their contracts, but they don't want to accept that lying down.

title.children: Buyers priced out of market as developer finds sunset clause loophole

image.altText: Police vehicles parked outside a restaurant with a neon sign saying "Marmont".

props.synopsis: The men were allegedly attacked on the Yarra Promenade overnight. Police arrested five teenagers and have charged three of them.

title.children: Teens charged after father and son allegedly stabbed in Melbourne

image.altText: A woman works on a wedding dress on a mannequin with wedding dresses on hangers behind her.

props.synopsis: Chinese Australian women are paying thousands of dollars to find love on matchmaking platforms in Australia, but behind the glossy promotions lies a different reality.

title.children: 'Why marry at all?' Woman upset at matchmaking service

image.altText: Ian Watkins is jailed for 35 years for child sex offences.

props.synopsis: British media reports Ian Watkins, the disgraced former Welsh rock band Lostprophets singer who was serving a 35-year jail sentence for child sex offences, has been killed by another inmate.

title.children: UK rock singer Ian Watkins reportedly killed in prison

image.altText: Two women stand in mud.

props.synopsis: Authorities have attributed the deadly downpours to Tropical Storm Priscilla, formerly a hurricane, and Tropical Storm Raymond, both off the western coast of Mexico.

title.children: At least 41 dead in Mexico after landslides, floods

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi hug.

props.synopsis: Regardless of its historical defence ties to Russia, or its economic reliance on the United States, India is politically non-monogamous.

title.children: Trump points finger at Putin as US relationship with India falters

image.altText: platypus swimming in water

props.synopsis: Almost 190 years on, in the place where Charles Darwin first spotted a platypus, the egg-laying mammal seems to have disappeared.

title.children: Platypus vanish from river where Charles Darwin pondered evolution

image.altText: A man in a boat holding up a fish he caught.

props.synopsis: The political party governing the Northern Territory announces a new president, just days after the opposition welcomed a former chief minister into its own leadership role.

title.children: Fishing fanatic and long-time CLP supporter to lead as party president

image.altText: a composite image of a dry down paddock next to a full crop of canola in bloom.

props.synopsis: After months of dust and dry skies, farmers on South Australia's Limestone Coast have welcomed early spring rain and a promising season ahead.

title.children: Once parched and bare, these paddocks are now flourishing again

image.altText: A cat sitting on a woman's lap perched on the handlebars of a motorbike.

props.synopsis: Raised alongside working dogs, Mango isn't your average feline and comes complete with his own Facebook page, loyal followers and fan mail.

title.children: Move over muster dogs — there's a new cat in town

image.altText: An outline of a woman.

props.synopsis: The NT has Australia's highest rates of domestic and family violence, with an intimate partner homicide rate seven times the national average.

title.children: The NT has changed its response to the DV crisis. Here's how

image.altText: Michael Storer smiles and holds his arms in the air while standing on the podium

props.synopsis: Perth's Michael Storer becomes the first Australian to make the Tour of Lombardy podium in 39 years, but he still can't live with the amazing Tadej Pogačar.

title.children: Storer makes Aussie cycling history but is no match for Pogačar at Il Lombardia

image.altText: Smiling man in cap looks at camera.

props.synopsis: From the Desert to the Seaside arts and music festival brings Western Australia's largest remote community of Bidyadanga together.

title.children: Music festival remote Indigenous community's biggest event in a decade

image.altText: A surf life saving red and yellow flag on the beach

props.synopsis: A record number of beaches in SA are set to have Surf Life Saving patrols seven days a week this summer, as the state grapples with its toxic algal bloom.

title.children: SA life savers to battle algal bloom with extra summer patrols

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit and tie with his arms crossed. He stares at the camera. The Hard Quiz Kids logo is in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Hard Quiz Kids is back. The more basic questions should be right up your alley.

title.children: Dream of trivia glory? Let's play, HARD!
